fields.value: The Economic Returns to Investing in Girls

authorAffiliation.value: Poverty, Gender and Youth Program, Population Council; The Girl Innovation, Research, and Learning (GIRL) Center, Population Council
The Girl Innovation, Research, and Learning (GIRL) Center, Population Council
Poverty, Gender and Youth Program, Population Council; The Girl Innovation, Research, and Learning (GIRL) Center, Population Council

dsDescriptionValue.value: The following contains the datasets, code, and other materials associated with the infographic "The Economic Returns to Investing in Girls". Included are a brief working paper regarding methodology, statistics and references used for calculated results, as well as data from ILO and the World Bank (downloaded in February-March 2017) utilized to calculate economic returns based on the changes in the gender labor gap.

files.description: Infographic with pathways visualizing the economic gains in investing in girls (LMICs excluding China).
files.label: GIRLCenter_infographic.jpg

files.description: Code used to calculate the percentage change in GDP due to changes in the female labor force participation based on Aguirre et al 2012 and Daly 2007.
